desc:
As a global leader in cybersecurity, CrowdStrike protects the people, processes and technologies that drive modern organizations. Since 2011, our mission hasn’t changed — we’re here to stop breaches, and we’ve redefined modern security with the world’s most advanced AI-native platform. Our customers span all industries, and they count on CrowdStrike to keep their businesses running, their communities safe and their lives moving forward. We’re also a mission-driven company. We cultivate an inclusive culture that gives every CrowdStriker both the flexibility and autonomy to own their careers. We’re always looking to add talented CrowdStrikers to the team who have limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to our customers, our community and each other. Ready to join a mission that matters? The future of cybersecurity starts with you.
About the Role:
The Data Science team is expanding and is looking for our first UX Designer. As a Senior UX Designer, you are a strategic thinker who will lead design efforts to tackle complex problems and produce creative solutions for our users. You will need to think both about our customers using your designs as well as our internal stakeholders and engineers. Your primary focus will be to work with our strategy team, engineers, and scientists to take business, product, and technical requirements and derive a delightful UX design and experience. You will be reporting to the Senior Director of Data Science Strategy.
What You’ll Do:
Lead the UX process and workflow, and work closely with a cross-functional team to build and ship designs
Produce high-quality creative solutions to complex problems based on data, research and goals
Create clear user flows, wireframes, and prototypes for user interfaces
Plan and lead design sessions to generate ideas or feedback both remote and in-person
Partner closely with UI developers and Data Science Strategists on a day-to-day basis to create designs
Advocate for the user in projects
Work at both a detailed design level and a strategic level to influence the product and internal roadmaps
Work at the intersection of Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Data Science, Engineering, User Experience, and Product Management
What You'll Need:
Demonstrated experience in end-to-end user experience processes and workflows, including user journeys, task analysis, information architecture, wireframing, prototyping, and evaluative research methods
Understanding of the engineering mindset and extremely technical user bases
A passion for systems thinking
Exceptional use of design artifacts to effectively build alignment, communicate ideas, and deliver an experience
Experience in enterprise product design
Strong understanding of interaction patterns, accessibility, and best practices for user interface design
Ability to listen, understand and communicate complex problems
Online portfolio or work samples with the ability to walk us through your process
Bonus Points:
Experience in SaaS products
Experience with UX research methodologies
Experience designing for both end users and internal developers
Familiarity with designing global and accessible experiences
Knowledge of cybersecurity industry
Experience with machine learning concepts
#LI-Remote
#LI-RC1
Benefits of Working at CrowdStrike:
Remote-friendly and flexible work culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards
Comprehensive physical and mental wellness programs
Competitive vacation and holidays for recharge
Paid parental and adoption leaves
Professional development opportunities for all employees regardless of level or role
Employee Resource Groups, geographic neighbourhood groups and volunteer opportunities to build connections
Vibrant office culture with world class amenities
Great Place to Work Certified™ across the globe
CrowdStrike is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone is valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.
CrowdStrike is committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants for employment. The Company does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, creed, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy or pregnancy-related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or family status, veteran status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, membership or activity in a local human rights commission, status with regard to public assistance, or any other characteristic protected by law. We base all employment decisions-including recruitment, selection, training, compensation, benefits, discipline, promotions, transfers, lay-offs, return from lay-off, terminations and social/recreational programs-on valid job requirements. If you need assistance accessing or reviewing the information on this website or need help submitting an application for employment or requesting an accommodation, please contact us at
recruiting@crowdstrike.com
for further assistance.
Find out more about your rights as an applicant.
CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.
Notice of E-Verify Participation
Right to Work
CrowdStrike, Inc. is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base salary range for this position in the U.S. is $135,000 - $215,000 per year + variable/incentive compensation + equity + benefits. A candidate's salary is determined by various factors including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications, job level, supervisory status, and location.
Expected Close Date of Job Posting is:03-30-2025

desc:
Optic Marketing Group is looking for a Contract-to-Hire Web Designer I. The ideal candidate will have an eagle eye for design details and strong conceptual skills. Candidate must have an intermediate understanding level of using WordPress.

Desired Education Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree or Certificate equivalent - preferably in art, graphic design, web design, or related degree. Agency Experience preferred.

Summary of Duties & Responsibilities
Design/ code monthly publications
Design/ code monthly E-newsletters
Website creation and maintenance,
Creation of new ads for our clients,
Web/email videos
Animated ads
Conceptual web design
Design/ update WordPress themes
UX/UI for Optic dashboard and additional future applications
Optic print collateral
Optic Trade Show Collateral
Social Media Collateral
Client social media collateral

Primary Essential Functions
The designer must have sharp details and strong conceptual skills. Candidate must have an intermediate understanding level of using WordPress. This role will produce the look and feel page layout/themes, and UI/UX functionality for Home Services websites in accordance with the individual client's overall brand.


General Supporting Functions
The designer may be asked to create: monthly publications, monthly e-newsletters, and websites including maintaining our current sites, new ads for our clients, web/email videos, programmatic and animated ads.

Skills & Competencies
A cool head under pressure
Excellent organizational skills
Outstanding skills in Photoshop, Illustrator, XD
Web design best practices experience
Experience creating online advertisements
Knowledge of user experience
Knowledge of web standards, optimization, and web design best practices
Knowledge of HTML, CSS
Knowledge of open-source CMS such as WordPress
Knowledge of website development and UI/UX basic principles
Familiar with Bootstrap or FLEX for responsive web design
Familiar with web standards and cross-platform, cross-browser issues
Experienced in developing and testing across multiple browsers, devices
Previous experience in the home service industry (bonus)
Previous experience in e-commerce (bonus)

Education or Prior Work Experience
1-3 years working with WordPress
1-3 years in web development and design
- Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree or Certificate equivalent - preferably in art, graphic design, web design, or related degree.
Previous experience working at a marketing/advertising agency

What will make you stand out
Previous Agency experience
Experience in 3rd-party search marketing tools to help manage campaigns
Experience working with HVAC, plumbing, or other home service companies
Expert Excel skills

The Benefits
Medical, dental, vision, and insurance coverage
Work from home
Flexible work schedule
Quarterly whole-office team-building events
Top-of-the-line technology to get work done
Paid Vacations and 17 Paid Holidays
Paid Birthday Off
½ day Fridays giving you a long weekend
Commission opportunity for all employees
Annual education budget
Quarterly paid volunteer days
Monthly health and wellness benefit
Christmas Bonus

Optic’s hiring process
At Optic Marketing Group, we focus on providing an inclusive screening and interview process that allows us to assess the people we hire based on skillsets and potential. We value hiring people whose personal values align with our company values, while also adding something unique to our teams. The process can sometimes seem a little cumbersome and even lengthy because that’s how much we care about ourselves and you, as a potential fit. But if you do get the job, we’ll do our best to make sure it’s one you’ll never want to leave.

desc:
The Position
We are looking to add a Senior UX Designer to our team of creative and curious problem solvers. In this role, you'll be responsible for leading the UX phase of projects, contributing to overall project strategy, and collaborating with clients, project managers, UI designers, and developers to deliver effective websites and apps that meet both our clients' needs and their users' needs.
The Senior UX Designer is comfortable with leading large-scale projects and complex, enterprise-level opportunities. You can dive beneath the surface to find the "why" and distill those findings into actionable next steps to move the project forward. You are a strong communicator able to command a conversation to lead stakeholders through decisions assertively. You are a curious problem-solver and motivated self-starter who can forecast weeks into the future as you come out of the Discovery phase. As the owner of the strategy you proactively maintain documentation to allow you to be a resource for key decisions in the visual design and development phases. You're deeply invested in your projects to the extent you keep a pulse on scope and risk management and collaborate with project management to illuminate areas where additional support or potential scaling-up efforts are needed. In other words, you are driven by a passion for crafting elegant, user-centered solutions, prioritizing project health and outcomes, and thriving in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Responsibilities
Lead stakeholder workshops and conversations with clients to better understand project goals and establish consensus
Perform user research (surveys, interviews, focus groups, moderated/unmoderated testing, tree testing, etc) and interpret results
Perform usability audits of existing websites and apps, documenting where they deviate from best practices
Diagram user flows, build sitemaps, and define information architecture
Use Figma to wireframe pages, screens, features, and flows in an organized and easy-to-understand way
Lead client presentations, facilitate feedback, and drive progress and momentum while staying within project scope
Document functionality for designers, developers, and clients
Collaborate with project managers to define project plans and timelines, and to keep those up-to-date as projects progress
About you
You have:
Deep fluency and practical knowledge of usability best practices
Creative thinking and problem-solving skills
An ability to command a conversation and lead stakeholders through decisions
Strong understanding of accessibility and inclusive design principles and WCAG guidelines, and their impact on usability and user interfaces
Strong mentorship and leadership skills
Expert knowledge in Figma and comfortable using all of the tool's features
You have experience with:
Leading complex enterprise-level projects and crafting interfaces for both websites and apps
Leading presentations, workshops, exercises, etc.
Facilitating feedback, asking good questions, and driving consensus
User research and user testing methods
Communicating complex, interactive design concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization
A few of our awesome company perks and employee benefits!
Health dental, and vision insurance covered at 100% for you and your family
401(k) plan with matching
Flexible work schedule
Generous PTO, sick leave, and holiday schedule
Semi-annual team retreats
Annual technology, health, and productivity stipend
Monthly team paid lunches
Salary Range: $85,000 to $100,000, depending on experience.
At Savas Labs, we believe building a team full of diverse perspectives and experiences is vital to success. Therefore, we strongly encourage anyone historically underrepresented in tech to apply for this role. Savas Labs does not discriminate based on gender, sexual orientation, race, religion, citizenship status, age, or physical ability. Empathy, authenticity, and inclusivity are at the core of all we do.

desc:
Position Summary
We're looking for an experienced Design & Development Lead to boost team collaboration and elevate project delivery. This role combines strategic oversight with hands-on support, helping streamline workflows, maintain high quality, and align projects with business goals. You'll work closely with design and development teams to make an impact on creative and technical outcomes.
Team Leadership:
Mentor and support team members, promoting skill growth and a collaborative culture.
Support new team members through onboarding, helping them transition smoothly into the team.
Continuously improve team processes, workflows, and tools to enhance productivity and efficiency.
Project Support:
Collaborate on critical design and development tasks, especially during busy periods, to keep projects on track.
Maintain quality standards across all deliverables, including websites, social media assets, and marketing materials.
Ensure brand consistency across projects by aligning design and development with client and business objectives.
Strategic Oversight:
Champion brand strategy through style guides and brand guidelines.
Coordinate project goals with overall company objectives, bridging design, development, and marketing.
Foster innovation by staying current with trends and encouraging fresh, creative ideas.
Technical Leadership:
Maintain website stability through updates, troubleshooting, and quality assurance processes.
Oversee tools and resources, such as software and plugins, to ensure smooth team operations.
Promote best practices in QA, providing training to maintain high standards.
End-to-End Project Leadership:
Lead projects through planning, design, development, testing, and deployment for cohesive execution.
Guide deployment and technical practices, supporting team members during launches.
Take a leadership role in the development lifecycle, ensuring projects meet business goals and deliver success.

This role offers a clear growth path toward management as you drive collaboration, refine processes, and support high-quality outcomes.

What We're Looking For
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Design, Project Management, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Relevant certifications (e.g., Scrum Master/PMP, UX/UI, AI).
Minimum of 2 years of agency experience.
Technical Proficiency:
Intermediate knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Proficiency with design collaboration tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Zeplin).
Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Premiere, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
The right person for this role will be…
Proficient in Agile methodologies and experienced in leading projects from start to finish.
Skilled in project management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello, Asana, ClickUp).
Experienced with QA processes, including end-to-end testing for functionality and performance.
Knowledgeable in brand strategy, maintaining consistency across channels.
A strong leader with mentoring experience, fostering team growth and collaboration.
An effective communicator, engaging stakeholders and keeping projects aligned.
Experienced in cross-functional collaboration among designers, developers, and marketers.
A problem-solver with adaptability to pivot strategies as challenges arise.
Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects at once.
Innovative and open to exploring new ideas to push creative boundaries.

This position is a great fit for someone looking to make an impact while growing into a leadership role.

The Benefits
Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage options
Paid Life Insurance & A D & D Insurance
Work from home
Flexible work schedule
401k
Quarterly whole-office team-building events
Top-of-the-line technology to get work done
Paid Vacations and 17 Paid Holidays
Paid Birthday Off
½ day every Friday
Commission opportunity for all employees
Annual education budget
Quarterly paid volunteer days
Monthly health and wellness benefit
Christmas Bonus


Join a Team Aligned with Your Values
At Optic Marketing Group, we understand that success isn't just about skills and qualifications—it's about shared values and a collective commitment to excellence. We firmly believe that the foundation of great companies lies in the strength of their people. That's why we're excited to introduce you to our core values, the guiding principles that shape our culture and set the stage for success.
Focus on People: Connecting Beyond Business - We foster a culture of openness and honesty, both within our team and in our interactions with clients. At Optic Marketing Group, we prioritize treating everyone as individuals first and business leaders second. We're not just colleagues; we're a community that supports each other on a human level, ensuring that each person feels valued and heard.
Love What We Do: Passion Fuels Performance - Work is more than a series of tasks—it's a source of inspiration, fulfillment, and pride. Here, every member of our team loves what they do, and that passion radiates in the quality of our work. We go beyond the job description, seeing each project as an opportunity to excel and make a meaningful impact. When you join Optic Marketing Group, you're not just taking on responsibilities; you're embracing a role that brings joy and purpose.
Work Smarter AND Harder: Strive for Excellence - We believe in the power of hard work coupled with a commitment to continuous improvement. There are no shortcuts to success, and we don't shy away from putting in the effort. However, we're not just about working harder; we're about working smarter. Embracing challenges head-on, we seek innovative ways to enhance efficiency, ensuring that every effort contributes to our collective success.


Optic’s Hiring Process
At Optic Marketing Group, we focus on providing an inclusive screening and interview process that allows us to assess the people we hire based on skillsets and potential. We value hiring people whose personal values align with our company values while also adding something unique to our teams.

Below is an outline of how the hiring process moves forward from here.
Screening Question(s) - If we like what we see on your resume, you will receive a request to answer a preliminary screening question. Responses are then reviewed by the hiring manager, and interviewees are selected based on responses.
Phone Interview - Typically conducted by our CXO, this phone interview is a 15-20 minute phone conversation where we look to learn more about you, your background, and what you're looking for in your next role.
Zoom Interview - The hiring manager and a member of our leadership team will meet with you via Zoom for 30 minutes, and you will be asked more in-depth and sometimes technical questions to determine your fit for the precise opening on the team based on current needs.
Second Zoom Interview - Except in rare circumstances, this is the final round of interviews. This round is conducted over Zoom by a member of our leadership team and is designed to determine the best fit of any remaining candidates for the position.


The process can sometimes seem a little cumbersome and even lengthy, but we care about ourselves and you as a potential fit. If you do get the job, we’ll do our best to make sure it’s one you’ll never want to leave.
qualifications: ['Jira', 'Adobe Photoshop', 'Project Management', 'CSS', 'PMP', 'Trello', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'Mid-level', 'Adobe Creative Suite', 'Project management', "Bachelor's degree", 'JavaScript', 'Mentoring', 'Adobe Premiere', 'Agile', 'Sketch', 'Business Administration', 'Adobe InDesign', 'AI', 'Figma', 'Project leadership', 'Leadership', '2 years', 'Communication skills', 'HTML', 'Zeplin']

Maintain website stability through updates, troubleshooting, and quality assurance processes.
Oversee tools and resources, such as software and plugins, to ensure smooth team operations.
Promote best practices in QA, providing training to maintain high standards.
End-to-End Project Leadership:
Lead projects through planning, design, development, testing, and deployment for cohesive execution.
Guide deployment and technical practices, supporting team members during launches.
Take a leadership role in the development lifecycle, ensuring projects meet business goals and deliver success.

This role offers a clear growth path toward management as you drive collaboration, refine processes, and support high-quality outcomes.

What We're Looking For
Education & Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Design, Project Management, Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Relevant certifications (e.g., Scrum Master/PMP, UX/UI, AI).
Minimum of 2 years of agency experience.
Technical Proficiency:
Intermediate knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript.
Proficiency with design collaboration tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Zeplin).
Strong skills in Adobe Creative Suite (e.g., Premiere, InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop).
The right person for this role will be…
Proficient in Agile methodologies and experienced in leading projects from start to finish.
Skilled in project management tools (e.g., Jira, Trello, Asana, ClickUp).
Experienced with QA processes, including end-to-end testing for functionality and performance.
Knowledgeable in brand strategy, maintaining consistency across channels.
A strong leader with mentoring experience, fostering team growth and collaboration.
An effective communicator, engaging stakeholders and keeping projects aligned.
Experienced in cross-functional collaboration among designers, developers, and marketers.
A problem-solver with adaptability to pivot strategies as challenges arise.
Organized, detail-oriented, and capable of managing multiple projects at once.
Innovative and open to exploring new ideas to push creative boundaries.

This position is a great fit for someone looking to make an impact while growing into a leadership role.

The Benefits
Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage options
Paid Life Insurance & A D & D Insurance
Work from home
Flexible work schedule
401k
Quarterly whole-office team-building events
Top-of-the-line technology to get work done
Paid Vacations and 17 Paid Holidays
Paid Birthday Off
½ day every Friday
Commission opportunity for all employees
Annual education budget
Quarterly paid volunteer days
Monthly health and wellness benefit
Christmas Bonus


Join a Team Aligned with Your Values
At Optic Marketing Group, we understand that success isn't just about skills and qualifications—it's about shared values and a collective commitment to excellence. We firmly believe that the foundation of great companies lies in the strength of their people. That's why we're excited to introduce you to our core values, the guiding principles that shape our culture and set the stage for success.
Focus on People: Connecting Beyond Business - We foster a culture of openness and honesty, both within our team and in our interactions with clients. At Optic Marketing Group, we prioritize treating everyone as individuals first and business leaders second. We're not just colleagues; we're a community that supports each other on a human level, ensuring that each person feels valued and heard.
Love What We Do: Passion Fuels Performance - Work is more than a series of tasks—it's a source of inspiration, fulfillment, and pride. Here, every member of our team loves what they do, and that passion radiates in the quality of our work. We go beyond the job description, seeing each project as an opportunity to excel and make a meaningful impact. When you join Optic Marketing Group, you're not just taking on responsibilities; you're embracing a role that brings joy and purpose.
Work Smarter AND Harder: Strive for Excellence - We believe in the power of hard work coupled with a commitment to continuous improvement. There are no shortcuts to success, and we don't shy away from putting in the effort. However, we're not just about working harder; we're about working smarter. Embracing challenges head-on, we seek innovative ways to enhance efficiency, ensuring that every effort contributes to our collective success.


Optic’s Hiring Process
At Optic Marketing Group, we focus on providing an inclusive screening and interview process that allows us to assess the people we hire based on skillsets and potential. We value hiring people whose personal values align with our company values while also adding something unique to our teams.

Below is an outline of how the hiring process moves forward from here.
Screening Question(s) - If we like what we see on your resume, you will receive a request to answer a preliminary screening question. Responses are then reviewed by the hiring manager, and interviewees are selected based on responses.
Phone Interview - Typically conducted by our CXO, this phone interview is a 15-20 minute phone conversation where we look to learn more about you, your background, and what you're looking for in your next role.
Zoom Interview - The hiring manager and a member of our leadership team will meet with you via Zoom for 30 minutes, and you will be asked more in-depth and sometimes technical questions to determine your fit for the precise opening on the team based on current needs.
Second Zoom Interview - Except in rare circumstances, this is the final round of interviews. This round is conducted over Zoom by a member of our leadership team and is designed to determine the best fit of any remaining candidates for the position.


The process can sometimes seem a little cumbersome and even lengthy, but we care about ourselves and you as a potential fit. If you do get the job, we’ll do our best to make sure it’s one you’ll never want to leave.

desc:
About Nerdio
At Nerdio, our mission is to simplify the lives of IT professionals and maximize their Microsoft cloud and end user computing investments.

We support organizations of all sizes looking to deploy, manage, and cost-optimize native Microsoft technologies. We partner with Enterprises and Managed Service Providers all over the world to add value on top of their existing native Microsoft investments like Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), Windows 365, and Microsoft Intune.

Created in 2016, Nerdio has always taken a market-leading and collaborative approach to cloud deployment and management. In fact, our product roadmap is greatly influenced by the regular feedback we receive from having seen companies deploy AVD into production environments several thousand times using Nerdio technology.

Today, Nerdio is used in over 50 countries by more than 5,000 organizations of every size and vertical. We’re committed to delivering exceptional service and support, which starts with identifying and supporting the best staff possible.

We are a fast-moving, nimble company looking for individuals who are collaborative, empathetic, driven and who love to move at the speed of light. If you want to be part of the AVD transformation that Microsoft and Nerdio are leading, then we want to speak with you.

About the role
Nerdio is looking for a Graphic Designer to join our growing marketing team to create visual designs for Nerdio’s website, marketing campaigns, and events. This job is perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is a master of juggling multiple projects without breaking a sweat. You need to be a master at fast turnaround speeds and a team player. You will design and deliver marketing collateral, landing pages, blog headers, diagrams, social media visuals, videos, presentations, ads, event materials, signage, and more!

What you'll do
Develop and execute design concepts for various media, including digital, print, motion graphics, presentations and social platforms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create visually appealing graphic treatments and layouts for various marketing materials
Partner with Sales to uplevel key customer-facing assets, including (but not limited to) pitch decks and one-pagers
Utilize strong typography, color theory, and layout skills to produce aesthetically pleasing and effective designs
Help create and maintain design guidelines and tools to enable cohesive assets company-wide
Manage multiple design projects, adhering to deadlines and maintaining high-quality standards
Qualifications
Minimum of 5 years of experience in creative design
Strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of design projects
Proficiency in Figma and Adobe Creative Suite, extra points if you’re great at Premiere and After Effects
Illustration, Motion design, and Video editing skills a plus
Deep knowledge of design fundamentals in typography, color theory, layout, and hierarchy
Innate creativity and problem-solving skills, driven by a commitment to producing outstanding design work
Excellent teamwork and communication abilities, enjoys sharing information and ideas with others, capable of working harmoniously with diverse colleagues
A proactive attitude towards learning and skill enhancement
Working knowledge of CMS, email development, HTML and CSS
Familiarity with UX/UI design principles
Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts, or a related field
Benefits and Incentives
Competitive Base + Incentive Plan
Stock Options
Health and Welfare Plans*
Life and Disability Plans*
Retirement Plan*
Unlimited Flexible Paid Time Off......including your birthday off!
Collaborative Team Culture
Benefits for international employees, outside the US, vary by country.

Nerdio is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Nerdio is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.
qualifications: ['Typography', 'CSS', '5 years', 'Content management systems', 'Mid-level', 'Windows', 'UI design', 'Adobe Creative Suite', 'Color theory', "Bachelor's degree", 'Adobe Premiere', 'Graphic Design', 'UX', 'Figma', 'Video editing', 'Adobe After Effects', 'Microsoft Intune', 'HTML', 'Intune']

desc:
Job Title: Graphic Designer
Location: US or Remote
Reports To: Content and Branfing Manager
JD

Objectives
The primary objective is to bring on an in-house designer who understands the Polymaker brand deeply and consistently translates it into impactful, high-quality visual content.
Create Engaging Content: Develop visually compelling materials that resonate with our audience and elevate the brand.
Build a Cohesive Brand Identity and Ensure Consistency: Craft and maintain a unified visual identity that reflects Polymaker’s values and innovation.
Coordinate Content Creation Across Teams: Collaborate closely with various teams to guide and oversee content development.

Key Results
Deliver high-quality, platform-optimized graphics with 100% accuracy in format, size, and color standards for each project.
Increase campaign engagement metrics (e.g., click-through rate, social media interactions) by 20% through visually compelling assets.
Produce printed materials that effectively showcase the portfolio, with positive feedback from stakeholders.
Develop a comprehensive guide for presenting Polymaker’s product families, with adherence to brand guidelines by all teams.
Create and deliver marketing templates for internal and partner use, achieving 90% team satisfaction for ease of use and branding consistency.
Maintain a 100% brand compliance score across all content produced.
Successfully adapt assets for regional markets, ensuring cohesive brand presence worldwide.
Standardize internal documents (business cards, letterheads, etc.)

Responsibilities
1. Graphic Design & Branding
Design visual assets for digital campaigns, including web graphics, social media images, email templates, and online ads.
Create editorial content such as brochures, catalogs, and whitepapers to effectively showcase our products and educate customers.
Work closely with other teams to develop hero images and high-quality product visuals that highlight the quality and versatility of our 3D printing materials.
2. Cross-Department Collaboration
Partner with product development, marketing, and content teams to ensure alignment in branding, messaging, and product details.
Contribute innovative ideas in brainstorming sessions to support campaign and branding objectives.
3. Brand Consistency & Global Adaptation
Maintain and enforce brand guidelines across all creative outputs, adapting visuals for regional markets while preserving brand identity.
Support the development of a comprehensive brand book to ensure a consistent global brand presence.
4. Project Management
Manage multiple design projects, ensuring high-quality outputs within specified deadlines.
Experiment with design tools to enhance productivity and creativity in visual outputs.
5. Key Outputs
E-commerce and Selling Platform Assets: Develop product images, infographics, and lifestyle visuals for Amazon, Shopify, Meta Shop, and our website to increase engagement.
Brand Templates: Create digital and print templates for internal and partner use, ensuring they align with brand guidelines.
Print and Event Materials: Produce flyers, booth graphics, and event printables.
Banners and Email Designs: Design banners and branded email templates for campaigns and customer engagement.
Ads and Infographics: Generate ads and infographics to boost brand awareness and product value across digital ad platforms and social media.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Graphic Design, Visual Arts, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in digital and editorial design.
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) other tools like Klaviyo, Figma, Sketch, are a plus.
Strong portfolio with a focus on digital and print design, brand consistency, and professional aesthetics.
Excellent english and good communication skills.
Ability to execute creative briefs effectively.
Team player with a proactive attitude, able to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
qualifications: ['Adobe Photoshop', 'Adobe Illustrator', 'English', 'Mid-level', 'Adobe Creative Suite', '3 years', "Bachelor's degree", 'Graphic Design', 'Marketing automation', 'Sketch', 'Adobe InDesign', 'Figma', 'Communication skills', 'Layout design']

desc:
About Social Driver:

Social Driver is a digital agency with the strategies, ideas, creative, and technology to connect with people today, across websites, social media, branding, marketing, advocacy, and more. Our vision is to be the trusted agency partner for our clients. Our company mantra captures our mission, culture, and values: “We believe the future is bright, all progress is social, and the drivers make history.” We aim to provide our clients with digital solutions that help them meet their goals and, through that work, make an impact for a brighter future.

About this Position:

As a Senior Web Developer at Social Driver, you will be at the forefront of crafting and sustaining cutting-edge web solutions that propel our clients' success. Your role will involve collaborating with our talented Creative Studio of developers, designers, and strategists to develop responsive, intuitive websites. This position demands a perfect blend of technical acumen, creative problem-solving, and a passion for delivering outstanding digital experiences. You'll play a crucial role in shaping the digital presence of our diverse clientele, ensuring every project meets the highest standards of quality and performance.

Objectives & Responsibilities:

Open Source Technologies: Leverage your understanding of open source and community-based technologies to build robust, scalable solutions that cater to client needs.

End-to-End Development: Lead the development of WordPress websites from inception to completion, ensuring all project requirements are met and exceeded.

CSS/SASS, JavaScript, PHP Templating: Utilize your extensive knowledge of these languages to develop dynamic, responsive, and high-performance web pages.

Code Management: Use GitHub for effective version control, code management, and team collaboration.

Design Mockups: Accurately interpret and provide feedback to the Design team for technical feasibility. Seamlessly theme websites to match designs from Figma, working closely with the design team to ensure consistency and accuracy.

CSS Frameworks: Apply frameworks like Bootstrap, and component libraries like Skelementor, to ensure responsive and consistent web interfaces that enhance user experience.

JavaScript Libraries: Implement and customize charting libraries such as HighCharts, Charts.js, and D3 for dynamic data visualization.

Elementor Expertise: Expertly build and manage pages and component libraries using Elementor.

Content Strategy: Collaborate with content strategists on migration plans and CMS setup for content types and taxonomy to ensure seamless content integration.

Documentation: Support content strategists in creating comprehensive CMS training documentation for client education and usability.

SEO Best Practices: Provide expert recommendations incorporating SEO best practices and adapt to client feedback to achieve their goals.

Website Launch: Oversee the website launch process to ensure minimal downtime and negligible impact on SEO.

Coding Standards: Adhere to and promote coding standards set by technical management and industry norms, including conducting cross-browser tests and accessibility checks to ensure high-quality deliverables.

Plugin and Module Development: Develop and maintain WordPress plugin modules to extend website functionality.

Integration Experience: Integrate and utilize tools such as Google Analytics, Google Webmaster Tools, Neforum, Microsoft Dynamics 365, iMIS, Fonteva, Impexium, FormAssembly, and other AMS and form-building software.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
6+ years of experience in web development, and systems creation with WordPress, preferably within a digital marketing or software development environment.
Proficiency in QA tools and software, such as Asana, JIRA, Selenium, QTest, etc. Knowledge of programming languages (e.g., JavaScript, Python) for test automation is a plus.
In-depth understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP) and WPEngine’s developer tools, and technical solutions.
Excellent attention to detail and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently. Strong organizational and time management skills.
Proficient in accurately tracking time using Harvest and efficiently managing multiple tasks with project management tools such as Asana.
Bonus: experience with Webflow

How to Apply:

Apply online with your resume and a cover letter that outlines how you would be a great fit for the position.

Benefits:

We take pride in our culture and offer a competitive salary with great benefits, like flexible PTO, 401k, continuing education, phone reimbursement, medical dental, and vision, short-term/long-term disability, a bike-share membership, flexible work schedules including “Fast Lane” and “No Meeting Fridays”, and great colleagues.

Commitment to DEI:

Social Driver is committed to advancing diversity, equity, and inclusion in hiring, marketing, programming, and in all other aspects of the work we do. Diversity, equity, and inclusion are deeply connected to our mission, our success, and our culture.
qualifications: ['Jira', 'Computer science', 'Computer Science', 'CSS', 'Bootstrap', 'WordPress', 'D3.js', 'Web development', 'Selenium', 'Microsoft Dynamics 365', 'PHP', 'Project management', "Bachelor's degree", 'JavaScript', 'SASS', 'Usability', 'SEO', 'Software development', 'GitHub', 'Data visualization', 'Senior level', 'Google Analytics', 'Figma', 'Communication skills', 'Python', 'HTML', 'Time management', 'Information Technology']
